events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle at the intersection downtown.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after reviewing incident details and keywords indicated.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to handle the customer's auto accident claim for timely follow-up.
The customer received confirmation that their auto accident claim was acknowledged by the insurance company.
Request sent to the customer for submitting damage photos, police report, and vehicle registration documents.
Customer submitted all requested documents including accident photos and official police report on time.
The claims investigation team began evaluating the collision circumstances and verifying submitted evidence.
Investigation concluded confirming the vehicle collision took place as reported, with all data verified.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover repair costs and rental expense for the damaged vehicle.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and clear communication throughout the process.
The auto accident claim was officially approved following the customer's acceptance of the settlement terms.
Insurance payment was issued to the customer for the vehicle repairs and related expenses agreed upon.
The claim was formally closed after successful payment issuance and confirmation from the customer.
All claim files and related documents were archived securely for future reference and compliance records.
